Process Overview ​

Master Permission Request Flow ​

The permissions seeking process follows a structured workflow from initial request through completion:

Complete Item Lifecycle ​

This diagram shows the full lifecycle of a permission request from creation to closure:

High-Level Process Stages ​

Stage 1: Request Initiation ​

  1. Project Creation - New book/journal project entered in RPC
  2. Rights Items Identified - Third-party content flagged for permissions
  3. Initial Assessment - Tier classification assigned

Stage 2: Rights Holder Identification ​

  1. Source Analysis - Examine the original publication
  2. Ownership Research - Determine current rights holder
  3. Contact Discovery - Find appropriate contact method

Stage 3: Permission Request ​

  1. Channel Selection - Choose contact method (email, portal, CCC)
  2. Request Submission - Send permission request
  3. Documentation - Log request in RPC

Stage 4: Follow-up & Negotiation ​

  1. Response Tracking - Monitor for replies
  2. Follow-up Cadence - Systematic reminder schedule
  3. Negotiation - Address terms, fees, conditions

Stage 5: Resolution & Closure ​

  1. Permission Granted - Document terms in RPC
  2. Permission Denied - Notify editorial, find alternatives
  3. Closure - Update project status, archive documentation

Key Decision Points ​

DecisionOptionsDetermines
Tier ClassificationTier 0-4 (HS) or Tier 1-3 (S&T)Workflow path
Mode of ContactAuthor, Publisher, CCC, PortalContact strategy
Fee ApprovalPay, Negotiate, Escalate, DeclineCost management
Denial HandlingAlternative source, Remove, Re-requestContent resolution

Workflow Variations ​

By Content Division ​

DivisionPrimary WorkflowCharacteristics
Health SciencesTier 0/4/Rule of 10High volume, standard medical content
S&TTier 1/2/3Lower volume, complex scientific content

By Content Type ​

Different content types require different handling approaches:

Content TypeTypical PathConsiderations
Figures/ChartsStandard flowMost common type
TablesStandard flowData accuracy critical
Photos/ImagesMay need model releasesPrivacy concerns
Text ExcerptsWord count mattersSTM guidelines apply
MultimediaSpecial handlingFormat considerations

MetricValue
